RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pric e $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIZZIES GIRL stalked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, launched her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, quickly overtook ANAAMY from along the rail entering the lane, and quickly drew off while being ridden out in the late stages. ANAAMY away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of SKY FACTOR entering the first turn, forced the pace from the outside of that rival in the run down the backside, quickly took control entering the final turn, drifted off the rail leaving the turn and was quickly overtaken by LIZZIES GIRL, and was no match for that foe late while proving clearly second best. VALERIE VALESKI away well and tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, maintained her position into the final turn while racing three wide, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to hold on for a share. DONE THAT was off a step slow, and trailed the filed into the first turn while saving ground along the inside, rallied two wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact while finishing three wide in the drive. SKY FACTOR broke sharply and vied for the lead from the inside of ANAAMY entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, was unable to keep tabs on her pace rival entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Sky Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Done That
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.OWNER: Goss Maureen Canmor Farms and Trombley Adrian
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, led, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Valerie Valeski
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4 ,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST MISTY was off a step slow, and steadied briefly off heels, but recovered quickly and split rivals to duel for the lead from the outside of GROOVY GIRL entering the first turn, assumed command entering the backstretch and controlled the pace through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late while being kept to task. TEXAS HUMOR away alertly and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to get up for the place. GROOVY GIRL broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dropped into a tracking trip while shifting off the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive and just failed to hold the place. ROSE OF TEXAS stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, continued three wide into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. DANCING WITH LIL away well, and stalked the early pace while racing three wide entering the backside, began to drop back midway to the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Groovy Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, tracked 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Just Misty
ENTRY.OWNER: Claggett Edwin MacPherson Craig and Armstrong Foster
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, dueled 2 wide, led, rallied inside, held

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dancing With Lil
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 27 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FINDING WAYS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and drew clear late under confident handling. GOOD BYE PUTIN settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and continued gamely from along the rail in the drive to get up for the place in the final strides. MR. QUALITY away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground along the inside, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed four wide in the drive to just miss the place. MORETHANSOULTITLE away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide while chasing the pacesetter into the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive while unable to hold his position. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER unhurried early and trailed the field into the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make a serious impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Finding Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2w, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Good Bye Putin
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside , closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Morethansoultitle
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 15000. (PLUS UP TO $5,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; , 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRETTY ARIA away alertly and raced to a narrow lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside of pace rival LASTING LIGHT entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and held QUEEN OF ATTITUDE safely at bay late to prevail. QUEEN OF ATTITUDE was off a step slow and trailed the compact field into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, began to advance from along the inside midway down the backside, rallied along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. LASTING LIGHT broke sharply and pressed the leader two wide entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide into the final turn, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the lane, and finished three out from the rail in the drive to prove best of the rest. KICK UP THE DUST away well and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing along the inside, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive while unable to make a late impact. SILK STILETTOS stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, trailed the field into the final turn, and needed more when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Kick Up the Dust
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Aria
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, held

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, advanced 3/8, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silk Stilettos
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, trailed, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACCORDINGLY trailed the field into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed steadily four wide in the drive to get up in the final strides. ROAD CLOSURE was off a step slow, and rushed up three wide entering the first turn while chasing the dueling leaders, assumed command mid way down the backside, and held a clear advantage into the final turn, maintained his advantage into the stretch, but tired late while unable to hold. WICKED NIGHT away well and was sent hard early to vie for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dropped into a tracking trip midway down the backstretch and into the final turn, saved ground through the turn, and finished determinedly three wide in the drive to just miss. GROOVIN' IS BAK broke sharply and stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide from between rivals approaching the wire. BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT was fractious prior to the start, was away alertly and dueled for the lead two wide from between rivals entering the backstretch, was unable to match strides with his pace rival in the run to the final turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Night
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Accordingly
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Groovin' Is Bak
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Brian's de Leight
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Road Closure
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, chased 3w, led, rallied inside, tired late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERFECT PENNY tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in deep stretch to get up in the closing strides. LILSISTERLEE broke sharply and raced to the lead while saving ground along the inside entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to hold off PERFECT PENNY late, while proving clearly second best. DRILL BABY DRILL away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing three wide in the drive to prove easily best of the rest. OKANAGAN GOLD stalked the early pace while saving ground entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while unable to make a serious late threat. HARBOUR STORM away alertly, and settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail while racing a bit rank into the first turn, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, but needed more late. CLASSY LEGACY settled at the back of the pack while racing three wide entering the backstretch, was always well back and failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Harbour Storm
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Okanagan Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Classy Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, rallied 3w, closed 4w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led inside, rallied rail, closed 3 wide, nipped

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $4,900 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BACK SHACK away alertly and set a contested pace from just off the rail entering the backstretch, took control midway down the backside, increased his advantage through the final turn, and widened that margin in the lane to prove best. KLIMTOGLORY tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, was shuffled back midway down the backstretch, rallied from just off the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in deep stretch to get up for the place. GREYTOGO broke sharply and tracking the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. Y VEE R away well and pressed the pace five wide entering the first turn, continued four out from the rail in the run down the backside while prompting the pace, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive. LOGICAL AL settled well off the early pace while saving ground along the inside entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest five wide in the stretch drive. CAB SAV dueled for the lead three wide from between rivals entering the backstretch, checked briefly when put in tight quarters midway down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive while unable to mount a late bid. BETTER TONE unhurried early while settling at the back of the field entering the backstretch, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and failed to make his presence felt late while finishing three out from the rail in the drive. RIMFIRE pressed the pace four wide from between rivals entering the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail through the final turn, steadied when pinched between rivals leaving the turn, and was unable to muster up a late response. Following the running of this race there were two jockey claims of foul. The rider of RIMFIRE lodged a claim of foul against the rider of Y VEE R for alleged interference leaving the final turn, and the rider of CAB SAV lodged a claim of foul against the rider of BACK SHACK for alleged interference midway down the backstretch. After review, both claims of foul were disallowed and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Logical Al
ENTRY.OWNER: Canoe Pass Stables and MacPherson Craig
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2w, shuffled 5/16, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Greytogo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Back Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Cab Sav
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3w, checked 5/16, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rimfire
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 4 wide, rallied 2 wide, checked 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Y Vee R
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilker Robert Gilker Victoria and Chu Ernie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 5 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,
